brief_summary.textblock: The Ohio Patient Navigator Research Program (OPNRP) proposes to alleviate disparities in relation to the timely diagnosis and treatment of breast, cervical and colorectal cancer in Columbus, OH.

primary_outcome.measure: Amount of time from abnormal evaluation of the breast, cervix, and colon or rectum to needed tests and treatment

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of barriers and effect of barriers on receiving needed tests and treatment

arm_group.description: Patient Navigator matched with subjects. Patient Navigators will be matched with subjects at the intervention clinics and will assist patients with questions, issues or concerns with their cancer treatment/diagnosis or abnormal test results and followup test or treatments

intervention.description: Subject is matched with a patient navigator. The patient navigator calls the patient. The amount of time between the abnormal test and treatment will be measured.
Subjects will be mailed informational/educational materials. The amount of time between the abnormal test and treatment will be measured.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Over age 18 years
- Be a regular patient of the primary care practice
- Be able to give informed consent
- Have had either an abnormal screening test, an abnormal diagnostic test, or an abnormal clinical finding leading to diagnostic testing for cervical, breast, or colorectal cancer, or a diagnosis of cervical, breast, or colorectal cancer
- Speak and understand English, or Spanish. For those participants who do not speak and understand English they will only be enrolled/consented into the program if translation services are available.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Cognitively impaired
- Prior history of cancer (except for nonmelanoma of the skin)
- Living in a nursing home
- Prior navigation
